bibl.title: Sheila GIBSON † and A.T. REYES, with an Appendix by Günter GRIMM and Judith S. McKENZIE, Reconstructing the Serapeum in Alexandria from the Archaeological Evidence.
bibl.note: I. Excavation of the site. - II. Archaeological plan. - III. Chronology of Ptolemaic structures. - IV. Reconstruction of the complex of Ptolemy III Euergetes I. - V. Reconstruction of the Roman complex. - VI. Date of Roman structures. - VII. Library in the Serapeum. - VIII. Sculpture in the Serapeum. - IX. Lageion (race-course). - X. Fourth-century A.D. descriptions of the Serapeum. - XI. Conversion of the Serapeum site to Christianity. - XII. Comparisons with other sanctuaries and conclusions. - Appendix (G.G. and J.S.M.): Architectural fragments found in the excavations of the Serapeum in Alexandria in c. 1900.
bibl.seg: McKENZIE Judith S., Sheila GIBSON † and A.T. REYES, with an Appendix by Günter GRIMM and Judith S. McKENZIE, Reconstructing the Serapeum in Alexandria from the Archaeological Evidence.
JRS 94 (2004) pp. 73-121, 16 plans et 9 pll. n./bl. + 1 pl. coul.

I. Excavation of the site. - II. Archaeological plan. - III. Chronology of Ptolemaic structures. - IV. Reconstruction of the complex of Ptolemy III Euergetes I. - V. Reconstruction of the Roman complex. - VI. Date of Roman structures. - VII. Library in the Serapeum. - VIII. Sculpture in the Serapeum. - IX. Lageion (race-course). - X. Fourth-century A.D. descriptions of the Serapeum. - XI. Conversion of the Serapeum site to Christianity. - XII. Comparisons with other sanctuaries and conclusions. - Appendix (G.G. and J.S.M.): Architectural fragments found in the excavations of the Serapeum in Alexandria in c. 1900.
